article.headline: Valparaiso 74, Northwestern St. 61
article.story: LAS VEGAS (AP) -- Dan Oppland had 20 points and nine rebounds to lead Valparaiso to a 74-61 win over Northwestern State in the first game of the Las Vegas Holiday Classic on Thursday night. Seth Colclasure scored 15 points on 5 of 7 shooting from 3-point range for the Crusaders (2-7), who opened the game with a 22-6 run to take control against Northwestern State (5-4). Jermaine Wallace scored 15 points to lead the Demons, who were outrebounded 37-25 and could not overcome 53 percent shooting by Valparaiso. The Crusaders made eight of their first 10 shots of the game to open up the big lead and made 58 percent of their 3-pointers in the game. Four Crusaders scored in double figures, including Jimmie Miles, who scored 12 points on 4 of 6 shooting. Jarryd Lloyd had 11 rebounds to go with his six points for Valpo. The Demons just couldn't keep up. Wallace was the only player in double figures as Northwestern State struggled to find open shots against the Crusaders.
